pull.title: util: Make our stringstream usage locale independent
pull.body:
Make our `stringstream` usage locale independent.

As discussed with laanwj in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18134#issuecomment-604031929. Fixes #18281.

events.body:

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18918 (wallet: Move salvagewallet into wallettool by achow101)
* #18608 (refactor: Remove CAddressBookData::destdata by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

rename.from: util: Make current implicit C++ locale assumption in tfm::format(...) explicit
rename.to: util: Make our stringstream usage locale independent. Formalize locale assumptions.

events.body: @sipa @laanwj Dropped the "util: Make implicit C++ locale assumptions explicit" commit. The current PR looks good? :)
@MarcoFalke Would you mind reviewing again? Your feedback has been addressed :)

events.message: util: Use LocaleIndependentStringStream() to get a std::stringstream with locale std::locale::classic()

events.body: Any interest in avoiding locale dependence? If not I'll close :)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1152,6 +1154,12 @@ TINYFORMAT_FOREACH_ARGNUM(TINYFORMAT_MAKE_FORMAT_FUNCS)
 template<typename... Args>
 std::string format(const std::string &fmt, const Args&... args)
 {
+    // Numerous tfm::format(...) callers are implicitly assuming that the output
+    // returned is locale independent. Notable examples include i64tostr, itostr
+    // and ScriptToAsmStr. Make sure to do a thorough review of all call sites
+    // (and other direct/indirect stringstream consumers) if this assumption is
+    // ever removed in the future.
+    assert(std::locale{} == std::locale::classic());
comments.body: I'd rather just make this explicitly use the classic locale than forcing a global assumption on the code (i.e. `oss.imbue(std::locale::classic());`).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1152,6 +1154,12 @@ TINYFORMAT_FOREACH_ARGNUM(TINYFORMAT_MAKE_FORMAT_FUNCS)
 template<typename... Args>
 std::string format(const std::string &fmt, const Args&... args)
 {
+    // Numerous tfm::format(...) callers are implicitly assuming that the output
+    // returned is locale independent. Notable examples include i64tostr, itostr
+    // and ScriptToAsmStr. Make sure to do a thorough review of all call sites
+    // (and other direct/indirect stringstream consumers) if this assumption is
+    // ever removed in the future.
+    assert(std::locale{} == std::locale::classic());

comments.body:
How does this have any effect? This is pretty much dead code (most of our format strings are c strings, so the other function is called). Might as well remove the code here to clarify this is not the primary implementation.

```suggestion
    return format(fmt.c_str(), args...);
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1152,6 +1154,12 @@ TINYFORMAT_FOREACH_ARGNUM(TINYFORMAT_MAKE_FORMAT_FUNCS)
 template<typename... Args>
 std::string format(const std::string &fmt, const Args&... args)
 {
+    // Numerous tfm::format(...) callers are implicitly assuming that the output
+    // returned is locale independent. Notable examples include i64tostr, itostr
+    // and ScriptToAsmStr. Make sure to do a thorough review of all call sites
+    // (and other direct/indirect stringstream consumers) if this assumption is
+    // ever removed in the future.
+    assert(std::locale{} == std::locale::classic());

comments.body: Ouch, good catch. I also thought this was the main entry point.
I've now given all functions the same treatment. Please re-review :)
Would it be possible to add a `static std::stringstream ClassicStringStream() { std::stringstream s; s.imbue(); return s; }` to our str util library, so that call sites have a lower LOC-overhead?
I think this can still be replaced by a single line `return format(fmt.c_str(), args...);`.
The module header is always included first, I think

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1126,6 +1131,7 @@ template<TINYFORMAT_ARGTYPES(n)>                                          \
 std::string format(const char* fmt, TINYFORMAT_VARARGS(n))                \
 {                                                                         \
     std::ostringstream oss;                                               \
+    oss.imbue(std::locale::classic()); /* Added for Bitcoin Core */       \
comments.body: Have you tried submitting this upstream? Other users might be interested in this, but it might have to be hidden behind a compile time flag.

comments.body: My plan is to do that if/when we get this in to Core :)
